title: Ekko's ultimate needs a damn mana cost
body:
Like how come an ability with insane base damages, 1.3 AP ratio, a heal, and a blink teleport, and an AOE spell have NO MANA COST? Seriously this ability of all abilities in existence needs to have a mana cost. In my opinion his ultimate should work better with mana as a risk reward. Basically the ultimate will cost you 100 mana. So you if you use it to escape, it burns 100 mana; however, if you use it on a target, depend how many targets you hit or maybe just at least 1-2 champions, you get mana _refunded_ back you. Basically it rewards you for going in with your ultimate so it returns your mana back because you didn't escape, but if you escape just like that you burn 100 mana. It allows for strategic decisions when playing Ekko, and he will use up mana.

EDIT: thank you all for the feed back! Just one other thing I should mention. This is not a QQ thread about Ekko. I am actually perfectly fine with his kit, I an just stating my opinion he should be changed a bit to offer balance.

How did they think not including a mana cost was okay? Who is making these decisions or promoting them? This is not cool, especially given how obvious it should be during testing that he is seriously freaking powerful with everything he has.

In terms of balancing preexisting champions, I can understand Riot's decisions; nerfing a champion into uselessness is not the way to go because every champion should be important. That said, unreleased champions that are very powerful on paper and then translate to being powerful during testing should not be this strong. Riot should have clued in on this from past releases where champs were blatantly OP (Xin, Brand, Jinx, Kalista) and I'm absolutely dumbfounded as to how in this situation they have yet again messed up. Either they wanted this to happen or something NEEDS to be done about the reliability internal testing.

I have to ask this for anyone on in this thread saying it needs a mana cost. If you have played ekko how many times have you actually managed to get an ult off without the enemy willingly walking next to the clone? The reason it doesnt have a cost is because he is the most unreliable assassin and the only way for him to reliably kill you is based on the opponents choices. So much of his kit has counterplay shoved into it that you could compare the number of counterplay options to how many things the individual skills do. He's actually got the most counterplay I have seen in a long time. If you want riot to put a mana cost on it he needs a way to use it that isnt 100% reliant on his opponent choosing to be next to it.

Honestly, propose this after all the ekko qq'ing has died down.  As it stands, there's just a general bias against Ekko.  You could suggest removing the shield from the W, or the blink from his E and people would agree to it, just because it was an Ekko nerf.

I am very surprised it does not have a mana cost for the amount of potential it gives. I see no reason why it should cost no mana and I am curious to see what Riot has to say about his free-to-cast ult. Riot seems to have given his ult no cost "just because".

If their excuse is that his ult is what makes Ekko iconic, then almost every champ should have a no-cost ability because every champ has some iconic skill.

The thing is, his ultimate is completely and entirely iconic within his kit.  Riot has been slowly moving towards no-cost ultimates on champions that rely on them heavily (e.g. Kennen), because being unable to use what is effectively over half of your kit because you don't quite have the resource feels terrible.

I haven't played enough in the current patch to really get a feel for this, but it seems to me that Ekko's ultimate is relatively easy for opponents to avoid seeing as there's a super obvious ghost trail that shows exactly where Ekko can blink to.  If you get hit by the burst you're either making a mistake or Ekko outplayed you, and I think that relationship is fine.
